events.description: You strengthened the Saskatchewan economy with reductions to business taxes including phasing out the Corporate Capital Tax eliminating the Corporate Capital Tax immediately on new investments reducing the Corporate Income Tax and reducing the small business threshold.

events.description: You strengthened the Saskatchewan economy with reductions to business taxes including phasing out the Corporate Capital Tax eliminating the Corporate Capital Tax immediately on new investments reducing the Corporate Income Tax and reducing the small business threshold.

events.description: This community truly does have the virtues of a village — diverse neighbourhoods small-business people artists musicians and school children.

events.description: Speaker how diligent this organization really is in surveying its 5200 members in our province and letting us know what the small-business community is saying and what the entrepreneurial community is saying.
events.title: Debates on 06-05-16

events.description: With 98 per cent of all firms in the province employing less than 50 workers each it’s clear that small business is vital to the health of the provincial economy — which is why we are pleased to have the CFIB as part of the budget consultation process and even more pleased to have received a letter from CFIB’s Saskatchewan director of provincial affairs Marilyn Braun-Pollon commending the government for implementing the recommendations to the business tax committee and for providing a provincial tax credit for workers who provide their own tools and for taking measures to address the shortage of qualified labour.
events.title: Debates on 06-05-16

events.description: In Saskatchewan the CFIB [Canadian Federation of Independent Business] represents over 5000 businessmen and women and works diligently to ensure that the concerns of small business are voiced.
events.title: Debates on 06-05-15

events.description: I would ask all members to thank the CFIB for presenting a strong voice for small business in Saskatchewan as businessmen and women are the engines of our province’s economy.
events.title: Debates on 06-05-15

events.description: This rate is levied on income that’s not eligible for the small-business or the manufacturer and processing rate reductions.

events.description: Another thing that we recommended is making small-business tax rates competitive in Saskatchewan.

events.description: We are also making changes to increase the amount of income eligible for small businesses to qualify for the small-business tax rate.

events.description: Then for small businesses — the major engine in our economy — we’ll increase the small-business threshold from $300000 to $500000 by July 1 2008 and immediately convert the non-refundable investment tax credit for manufacturing and processing into a refundable tax credit and extend the carry forward for unused ITCs [investment tax credit] previously earned to 10 years .

events.description: Deputy Speaker my constituency hails from Rosthern to North Battleford up to Shellbrook over to Spiritwood — it’s basically all agriculture and small business.

events.description: Deputy Speaker I also think of the small-business people in my constituency.
events.title: Debates on 06-04-10

events.description: I think of them and I know that 72 per cent of the jobs created in Canada in Saskatchewan are created in shops that are owned and operated by small-business people.
events.title: Debates on 06-04-10

events.description: Small-business people are the engines that drive our economy.
events.title: Debates on 06-04-10

events.description: And effective July 1 2006 the general corporate income tax rate will be reduced from 17 per cent to 14 per cent and the small-business threshold increased from 300000 to 400000.
events.title: Debates on 06-04-10

events.description: Effective July 1 2007 the income tax rate will be reduced from 14 per cent to 13 per cent and the small-business threshold increased from 400000 to 450000.
events.title: Debates on 06-04-10

events.description: On July 1 2008 the income tax rate will be reduced from 13 per cent to 12 per cent and the small-business threshold increased from 450 to $500000.
events.title: Debates on 06-04-10

events.description: Speaker this budget stands up for our small-business people in our economy and this is why when I talk to them and ask them about this budget they tell me this budget is good for me.
events.title: Debates on 06-04-10

events.description: This budget will increase the small-business threshold from  $300000 to $500000 by July 1 2008.
events.title: Debates on 06-04-10

events.description: And I want to say on this increase to the small-business threshold Madam Speaker that it is a commitment of the New Democratic Party to increase the threshold from $300000 to $400000.
events.title: Debates on 06-04-10

events.description: We hosted last year to open our centennial Saskatchewan’s first economic summit where we brought together business leaders small-business people working people trade unionists Aboriginal people young people the entire cross-section of the province of Saskatchewan.

events.description: As such I’m announcing that we will raise the ceiling for small businesses by increasing the threshold to qualify for the small-business tax rate from 300000 to 500000 by July 2008.
